snippet: Nicholas Santora, who has reputedly been a leader in the Bonanno crime family since the 1970s, is charged with enterprise corruption, along with three younger men whom the prosecution described as soldiers in the organization.
abstract: Prosecution makes opening arguments in trial of Bonanno crime family leader Nicholas Santora in which case is made that Santora remained powerful Mafia captain even in 2010, despite widely held view that family had been crippled by prosecutions and defections; Santora is on trial for enterprise corruption.
lead_paragraph: Nicholas Santora, who has reputedly been a leader in the Bonanno crime family since the 1970s, is charged with enterprise corruption, along with three younger men whom the prosecution described as soldiers in the organization.

headline.main: Prosecutor Details Mob Ties of Reputed Leader and 3 Others as Trial Begins
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Details Links to Mob Clan as Trial Starts
